Actually, asking for reports is punishable.  I don't know how people don't understand the IFS at this point.  It's seems intentionally being obtuse at some point.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/PzY1ArN3-we-dont-ban-people-for-asking-for-reports

NaKayle did a poor job explaining it. 

The point of that thread is that saying “Report Xerath” at the end of the game isn’t enough to trigger a punishment. However, spending an entire game campaigning to get somebody reported is harassment.

He is definitely not saint, but calling it "spending the entire game campaigning to get somebody reported" is quite a stretch. If he was previously banned for hate speech (a single punishment over a lifetime), this is not only a very mildly toxic log, but also a clear sign of improvement.

OP is a living embodiment of the most infuriating part of the ZT system.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/xAAcRMo4-the-incompatibility-of-zero-tolerance-with-the-tiered-penalty-system

Notice how this thread's topic is getting ignored by Rito.

I agree. The question is if this person should be on thin ice and perma'd for minor offences like this one. His previous punishment(the only one, as he claims and might be lying) was for some really nasty stuff, so he tuned it down to what he sees as an acceptable human level of communication, which is fairly logical and should be acknowledged by Riot by separating punishment ladder and ZT chatfilter.

Would his complaints get him disqualified in soccer? Hockey? Basketball?
I really doubt that. This is not a chatlog of some savage. This is a chatlog of someone who never got a single chat restriction.
That was 2 years ago. They've clearly changed their policy since, assuming that was ever accurate in the first place.
They didn't. I can say "report" once every game on a fresh smurf and not get a chat restriction by level 30.
Probably because most people don't know that it's an offense and won't report for it if that's all you do.

As far as we know they haven't officially changed their policy since that post by Nakyle. Therefore they are still officially following "We do not ban people for calling for reports." (A policy which I do not agree with; I believe report calling should be one of the punishable offenses, but Riot should also tell everyone that it is so, so people would know not to do that).

I personally don't see the chat log as punishable, and I am usually one of those "hang them and let them rot" people. Only part that I consider even slightly negative is the report calling but, but since it isn't used for harassment really - I would let that pass if that happened in a match I am in.

Then why are there so many chat logs where the only punishable part is calling for reports?

Actions mean more than words, and Riot's actions disagree with their words on this subject.

That is not something for me to answer, but Riot to do so. However I haven't seen these "many chat logs where the only punishable part is calling for reports." I have seen this one and even this one has some other parts with light negativity (It doesn't help to point out other people's mistakes like "not helping to clear camps" or other things which have already happened). However, I still do not see why this person was punished for this chat log. Well, I do not see how people have the time to type this much during a match either (but that isn't punishable either - however, it is easier for the automated system to "detect" something bad from lots of text than only a little (or no) text)

>but instead of instantly permabanning me couldn't they just give me a chat restriction 

no

because the punishments are related to each other

let's assume you have a clean account and you are toxic on it

you get a 10 game chat restriction, which is the lowest punishment you can get for breaking the rules

if you continue to display toxic behaviour, you get a 25 game chat restriction

if you continue to display toxic behaviour, you get a2 week ban

if you continue to display toxic behaviour, you get a permban

aditionally you can get 2 week banned on the first offense if you use hate speech, racism, stuff like "fa ggot" and "nig ger" or urge someone to end their own life by using phrases like "k ys"

if you have a 2 week ban, the next punishment **unless you reform** is a permaban because the punishments are given out in ascending order of annoyance

>My friend had 3 bans and about 6 chat and ranked restrictions but didn't get a single permaban yet

it's possible that your friend reformed in between the bans just enough so that he dropped one tier of punishment or two before the next one came up
